title: Command Line
tagline: Complete complex tasks with just a few keystrokes.
description: Introduction to the UNIX command line. Topics covered will include navigating the filesystem, manipulating the environment, executing useful commands, and using pipes to communicate between programs. This session will teach you how to communicate directly with your computerâ€™s operating system using a text-based interface and is a useful first step in learning many other technical skills. For more information, visit: http://swcarpentry.github.io/shell-novice/

title: Git
tagline: Simplify collaboration using version control systems.
description: Git is a tool for managing changes to a set of files. It allows users to access open source repositories, recover earlier versions of a project, and collaborate with other contributors. This session will be beneficial to anyone working with data, code, or text. For more information, visit: http://swcarpentry.github.io/git-novice/

title: Python
tagline: Use Python for everything from data analysis to building websites.
description: Python is a programming language that can be used for a wide range of tasks, including collecting and analyzing data and building web applications. It is likely the most popular language for academic researchers. This session will be useful for anyone who wants to take a programmatic approach to research. For more information visit: http://swcarpentry.github.io/python-novice-inflammation/

title: Text Analysis
tagline: Process, analyze, and summarize textual data using NLTK.
description: The Natural Language Toolkit (NLTK) is a Python library that allows researchers to work with text-based data, such as literary works or social media corpora. Through attending this session, you will learn how to use Python to analyze large amounts of text to find word frequencies, collocations, and other patterns invisible from a non-computational perspective. This session will be of particular use to researchers who work with any form of text-based data.

title: HTML, CSS, and Javascript
tagline: Share your research using web development fundamentals.
description: Modern web pages are created using HTML to control content, CSS to control appearance, and JavaScript to dictate behavior. This session will be helpful for anyone that wants to build on the web.

title: Machine Learning
tagline: Explore the structure of data using machine learning algorithms.
description: This session will introduce regression analysis, data preprocessing, model selection, supervised and unsupervised machine learning and dimension reduction using the sklearn machine learning library. This session is aimed towards researchers who want to find patterns in their data or use their data to predict a phenomena.
